unittitle.value: Robin Kelley <title render="italic">Hammer and Hoe</title> Oral History Collection

extent.value: in 1 shared cassette box and one compact disk box.

abstract.value: The collection's interviews were conducted by Robin Kelley as research for his book <title render="italic">Hammer and Hoe: Alabama Communists During the Great Depression.</title> The book, which was published by the University of North Carolina Press in 1990, documents the activities of the Alabama Communist Party in the 1930s and the impact of race and other cultural identities on the movement. The collection contains twelve oral history interviews taken by Kelley and one recorded radio program.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Robin Kelley <title render="italic">Hammer and Hoe</title> Oral History Collection; OH 040; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Robin Kelley in 1997. The accession number associated with this gift is 1997.077.

The collection's interviews were conducted by Robin Kelley as research for his book <title render="italic">Hammer and Hoe: Alabama Communists During the Great Depression</title>. The book, which was published by the University of North Carolina Press in 1990, documents the activities of the Alabama Communist Party in the 1930s and the impact of race and other cultural identities on the movement.

The collection contains twelve oral history interviews taken by Kelley and one recorded radio program. The collection documents the experiences of individuals involved with the Alabama Communist Party during the Great Depression.

corpname.value: Communist Party of the United States of America
